item.title: Godot Conference 2023: Call for Participations
item.description: GodotCon 2023 needs participations
item.dc:creator: Julian Murgia

item.title: Godot Rendering Priorities: July 2023
item.description: The Godot rendering team continues to focus on stability, performance and usability
item.dc:creator: Clay John

item.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.0.4
item.description: A fresh pack of stability and documentation improvements for teams still using Godot 4.0 is officially out!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 2
item.description: Closing the first month of development of Godot 4.2, the second development snapshot includes both smaller improvements and bigger features.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.0.4 RC 1
item.description: A new batch of backported fixes for Godot 4.0 is ready for testing! Even if you aren't able to move to Godot 4.1 just yet, we can't leave you without support and improvements.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 1
item.description: We are ready to share the first batch of improvements coming to Godot 4.2 later this year with the release of the first dev snapshot!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Join us at the Godot Conference 2023!
item.description: We are happy to announce that we are going to be hosting the 2023 GodotCon in Munich, Germany.
item.dc:creator: Emi

item.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.1.1
item.description: Hot on the heels of its parent release, here's Godot 4.1.1 — the first maintenance release of the 4.1 branch, with more stability and workflow improvements.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1.1 RC 1
item.description: The first round of bugfixes and usability improvements for Godot 4.1 is ready for your consideration!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Godot Funding Breakdown & Hiring Process
item.description: This article aims to shed light on the current status of Godot's funding, hiring, and our plans for sustainable funding long term.
item.dc:creator: Godot Foundation

item.title: Godot 4.1 is here, smoother, more reliable, and with plenty of new features
item.description: Four months after the release of Godot 4.0, we are excited to bring you Godot 4.1 — an update with a focus on stability, performance, and polish.
item.dc:creator: Godot contributors

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1 RC 3
item.description: A few more critical regressions were fixed, and the milestone is now 100% complete. Let's confirm that 4.1 is ready with a (final?) RC.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1 RC 2
item.description: A few more regressions were fixed, and we should now be ready for the Godot 4.1 release. Help us confirm that by testing RC 2!
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1 RC 1
item.description: After 4 months of development, Godot 4.1 is only days away. To make sure it doesn't miss the mark, here's the first release candidate for your testing!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Godot community poll 2023
item.description: It's this time of the year! Godot Community Poll 2023 is now out!
item.dc:creator: Clay John

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.1 beta 3
item.description: We are getting confident in the state of Godot 4.1! To wrap things up here's the last beta release, bringing more fixes to reported issues.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Godot at BIG Festival 2023
item.description: Godot will have a booth and a talk at BIG Festival 2023, which takes place in São Paulo, Brazil from June 28th to July 2nd
item.dc:creator: George Marques

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.1 beta 2
item.description: Continuing on our planned schedule for Godot 4.1, we're advancing through the beta phase and getting ready for a stable release in early July.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.1 beta 1
item.description: Switching gears into the bug-fixing mode, here's the first beta of Godot 4.1, and a great opportunity to try the new version of the engine ahead of the official release.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.1 dev 4
item.description: This snapshot signifies that Godot 4.1 is now in feature freeze and will only receive bug fixes going forward. Enjoy this final package of new features and enhancements and give them a good shake!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.1 dev 3
item.description: The end of May means the approach of the feature freeze for Godot 4.1, and this dev snapshot aims to give you as many new features to test as possible.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 3.6 beta 2
item.description: Another beta build for Godot 3.6, implementing important bug fixes and some new features for existing games in production.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.0.3
item.description: A fresh portion of stability improvements and bugfixes for Godot 4.0 projects, 4.0.3 covers almost every area of the engine. It also comes with a massive bump in documentation coverage thanks to the newly updated rendering docs!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.0.3 RC 2
item.description: Another round of cherry-picks for the upcoming Godot 4.0.3, fixing a few regressions reported against RC 1 and backporting more important fixes.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde
